clusters.title: What we know about shooting of National Guard in Washington DC
clusters.neutral_headline: Shooting in Washington DC Leaves One Dead

items.title: What we know about shooting of National Guard in Washington DC
items.standfirst: Sarah Beckstrom, 20, has died, while Andrew Wolfe, 24, remains in a critical condition.
items.content: Sarah Beckstrom, 20, has died, while Andrew Wolfe, 24, remains in a critical condition.

items.title: One of two 2 National Guard members wounded in 'targeted shooting' has died
items.standfirst: US President Donald Trump said his administration will "permanently pause" migration from all "third world countries", following the death on Thursday of a National Guard member in an attack near the White House. Investigators say the shooting was carried out by an Afghan national who entered the US in 2021 under a resettlement programme. Florent Marchais has this story.
items.content: US President Donald Trump said his administration will "permanently pause" migration from all "third world countries", following the death on Thursday of a National Guard member in an attack near the White House. Investigators say the shooting was carried out by an Afghan national who entered the US in 2021 under a resettlement programme. Florent Marchais has this story.

items.title: Trump says US will pause migration from 'third-world countries'
items.standfirst: The president did not name which countries would be affected, but vowed to remove anyone "not a net asset" to the US.
items.content: The president did not name which countries would be affected, but vowed to remove anyone "not a net asset" to the US.

items.title: Full List of Countries Facing Green Card Reviews After DC Shooting
items.standfirst: The Trump administration will conduct a "full scale, rigorous re-examination" of every green card from every "country of concern".
items.content: The Trump administration will conduct a "full scale, rigorous re-examination" of every green card from every "country of concern".

items.title: Video Shows National Guard Shooting, Rahmanullah Lakanwal With Revolver
items.standfirst: New footage appears to show a National Guard member running down the street and suspect Rahmanullah Lakanwal holding a revolver.
items.content: New footage appears to show a National Guard member running down the street and suspect Rahmanullah Lakanwal holding a revolver.

items.title: Trump Admin ‘Looking at’ Deporting Rahmanullah Lakanwal’s Family
items.standfirst: President Donald Trump said Thursday that his administration is examining whether to deport the family members of Rahmanullah Lakanwal, the suspect accused of shooting two National Guard members in Washington, D.C. When asked directly by a reporter whether he intends to remove Lakanwal’s wife and…

When asked directly by a reporter whether he intends to remove Lakanwal’s wife and…

items.title: National Guard member dies after shooting in Washington DC
items.standfirst: Sarah Beckstrom, 20, succumbed to her injuries, while a second guardsman remains in critical condition, Donald Trump says.
items.content: Sarah Beckstrom, 20, succumbed to her injuries, while a second guardsman remains in critical condition, Donald Trump says.

items.title: US to review immigration from 19 countries after Washington DC double shooting
items.standfirst: The US will review green cards issued to the citizens of 19 countries after two members of the National Guard were shot by a suspected Afghan gunman in Washington DC.
items.content: The US will review green cards issued to the citizens of 19 countries after two members of the National Guard were shot by a suspected Afghan gunman in Washington DC.

items.title: Trump vows to 'permanently pause' migration from poor nations in social media screed
items.standfirst: President Donald Trump vowed on Thanksgiving to "permanently pause migration" from poorer nations in a blistering late-night, anti-immigrant screed posted to social media.
items.content: President Donald Trump vowed on Thanksgiving to "permanently pause migration" from poorer nations in a blistering late-night, anti-immigrant screed posted to social media.(Image credit: Alex Brandon)

items.title: Trump suspends immigration from ‘Third World’, orders review of green cards
items.standfirst: Green card applications from 'countries of concern' will be reviewed after Afghan national named as shooting suspect.
items.content: Green card applications from 'countries of concern' will be reviewed after Afghan national named as shooting suspect.

items.title: Trump says he will suspend immigration from all "Third World Countries"
items.standfirst: In a social media post, President Trump wrote that he "will permanently pause migration from all Third World Countries to allow the U.S. system to fully recover."
items.content: In a social media post, President Trump wrote that he "will permanently pause migration from all Third World Countries to allow the U.S. system to fully recover."

items.title: Trump says he will ‘permanently pause’ migration from ‘third world countries’ after national guard shooting
items.standfirst: In a social media post sent late on Thanksgiving, US president said he would ‘end all federal benefits and subsidies to noncitizens’ following Washington DC shootingDonald Trump has said he will “permanently pause migration from all third world countries,” a day after two national guard members were shot in Washington DC in an attack that has become a political flashpoint in the president’s ongoing crackdown on immigration.In a social media post beginning with “a very happy Thanksgiving,” sent after 11pm on Thursday, the US president said his administration would “end all federal benefits and subsidies to noncitizens” and remove “anyone who is not a net asset to the United States”. Continue reading...
items.content: In a social media post sent late on Thanksgiving, US president said he would ‘end all federal benefits and subsidies to noncitizens’ following Washington DC shootingDonald Trump has said he will “permanently pause migration from all third world countries,” a day after two national guard members were shot in Washington DC in an attack that has become a political flashpoint in the president’s ongoing crackdown on immigration.In a social media post beginning with “a very happy Thanksgiving,” sent after 11pm on Thursday, the US president said his administration would “end all federal benefits and subsidies to noncitizens” and remove “anyone who is not a net asset to the United States”. Continue reading...

items.title: One of 2 National Guard members shot in D.C. has died, Trump says
items.standfirst: Two members of the West Virginia National Guard were shot a few blocks from the White House on Wednesday, and a suspect identified as an Afghan national is in custody.
items.content: Two members of the West Virginia National Guard were shot a few blocks from the White House on Wednesday, and a suspect identified as an Afghan national is in custody.

items.title: Trump admin. sending 500 more Guard troops to D.C. after shooting, Hegseth says
items.standfirst: The Trump administration plans to deploy another 500 members of the National Guard to the streets of Washington, D.C., Defense Secretary Pete Hegseth announced, hours after two service members were shot.
items.content: The Trump administration plans to deploy another 500 members of the National Guard to the streets of Washington, D.C., Defense Secretary Pete Hegseth announced, hours after two service members were shot.

items.title: Trump admin. pauses immigration applications from Afghans after National Guard shooting
items.standfirst: Federal immigration authorities said Wednesday they have paused processing requests from Afghan nationals, after a man from Afghanistan was identified as the suspect in the D.C. National Guard shooting.
items.content: Federal immigration authorities said Wednesday they have paused processing requests from Afghan nationals, after a man from Afghanistan was identified as the suspect in the D.C. National Guard shooting.

items.title: Second National Guard member shot in D.C. is "fighting for his life," Trump says
items.standfirst: President Trump said Thursday evening that Army Spc. Sarah Beckstrom died from her injuries in the Washington, D.C., shooting, and Air Force Staff Sgt. Andrew Wolfe was "fighting for his life."
items.content: President Trump said Thursday evening that Army Spc. Sarah Beckstrom died from her injuries in the Washington, D.C., shooting, and Air Force Staff Sgt. Andrew Wolfe was "fighting for his life."

items.title: Trump celebrating Thanksgiving at Mar-a-Lago
items.standfirst: On Wednesday night, two members of the National Guard were shot near the White House​.
items.content: On Wednesday night, two members of the National Guard were shot near the White House​.

items.title: One of the National Guard troops shot in D.C. attack has died, Trump says
items.standfirst: President Trump told reporters Thursday night that Army Spc. Sarah Beckstrom has died. Beckstrom was one of the National Guard troops shot in Wednesday's Washington, D.C., ambush attack. Andrew Wolfe, the other victim, is still in critical condition. CBS News' Nicole Sganga reports.
items.content: President Trump told reporters Thursday night that Army Spc. Sarah Beckstrom has died. Beckstrom was one of the National Guard troops shot in Wednesday's Washington, D.C., ambush attack. Andrew Wolfe, the other victim, is still in critical condition. CBS News' Nicole Sganga reports.

items.title: Trump officials announce sweeping immigration reviews after national guard shooting
items.standfirst: Donald Trump signaled after attack that refugee and asylum cases would be scrutinizedTrump administration officials say they are undertaking a broad re-examination of asylum cases and green cards issued to citizens of certain countries, after the shooting of two national guard members near the White House in Washington DC on Wednesday.The Department of Homeland Security (DHS) named the suspect in the shooting as Rahmanullah Lakanwal, a 29-year-old Afghan national who entered the US under a policy set up under Joe Biden after the US withdrawal from Afghanistan in 2021 and continued under Donald Trump. Continue reading...
items.content: Donald Trump signaled after attack that refugee and asylum cases would be scrutinizedTrump administration officials say they are undertaking a broad re-examination of asylum cases and green cards issued to citizens of certain countries, after the shooting of two national guard members near the White House in Washington DC on Wednesday.The Department of Homeland Security (DHS) named the suspect in the shooting as Rahmanullah Lakanwal, a 29-year-old Afghan national who entered the US under a policy set up under Joe Biden after the US withdrawal from Afghanistan in 2021 and continued under Donald Trump. Continue reading...

items.content: US president says second National Guard member 'fighting for his life' after attack a day earlier in Washington, DC.

items.title: National Guard's Sarah Beckstrom dies following shooting near White House
items.standfirst: US President Donald Trump said on Thursday that National Guard soldier Sarah Beckstrom, one of two troops shot near the White House a day earlier, had died, while the other remained “fighting for his life”. Trump called Beckstrom a “highly respected, young, magnificent person”.
items.content: US President Donald Trump said on Thursday that National Guard soldier Sarah Beckstrom, one of two troops shot near the White House a day earlier, had died, while the other remained “fighting for his life”. Trump called Beckstrom a “highly respected, young, magnificent person”.

items.title: Trump administration orders green card "reexamination" from "countries of concern"
items.standfirst: The review comes after an Afghan national who arrived in the U.S. in 2021 was arrested in the shooting of two National Guard members.
items.content: The review comes after an Afghan national who arrived in the U.S. in 2021 was arrested in the shooting of two National Guard members.

items.title: D.C. National Guard shooting suspect worked with CIA in Afghanistan
items.standfirst: A 29-year-old Afghan national named Rahmanullah Lakanwal has been identified as the suspected shooter in the ambush that killed one National Guard member and wounded another in D.C., officials say.
items.content: A 29-year-old Afghan national named Rahmanullah Lakanwal has been identified as the suspected shooter in the ambush that killed one National Guard member and wounded another in D.C., officials say.

items.title: Trump suspends migration from ‘third world countries’ after National Guard shooting
items.standfirst: US President Donald Trump said his administration will "permanently pause" migration from all "third world countries", following the death on Thursday of a National Guard member in an attack near the White House. Investigators say the shooting was carried out by an Afghan national who entered the US in 2021 under a resettlement programme.
items.content: US President Donald Trump said his administration will "permanently pause" migration from all "third world countries", following the death on Thursday of a National Guard member in an attack near the White House. Investigators say the shooting was carried out by an Afghan national who entered the US in 2021 under a resettlement programme.

items.title: U.S. to re-examine green card holders from 19 countries 'of concern'

items.content: The announcement comes a day after an attack on National Guard troops near the White House. Authorities have identified the suspect as an Afghan national.

items.title: What was 'Operation Allies Welcome,' which allowed some Afghans entry into the U.S.?
items.standfirst: The Afghan man suspected of shooting two National Guard members entered the U.S. under the program in 2021. Here's a look at why it was set up and how those who entered the U.S. were vetted.
items.content: The Afghan man suspected of shooting two National Guard members entered the U.S. under the program in 2021. Here's a look at why it was set up and how those who entered the U.S. were vetted.(Image credit: Anthony Peltier)

items.title: Suspect in Washington DC shooting who 'worked with CIA in Afghanistan' pictured
items.standfirst: A man suspected of opening fire on two members of the National Guard a few streets from the White House is an Afghan national who worked with a CIA-backed unit in Afghanistan, according to officials.
items.content: A man suspected of opening fire on two members of the National Guard a few streets from the White House is an Afghan national who worked with a CIA-backed unit in Afghanistan, according to officials.

items.title: Watch: How the shooting of two National Guard members unfolded
items.standfirst: The two soldiers are in critical condition after being attacked blocks from the White House in Washington DC.
items.content: The two soldiers are in critical condition after being attacked blocks from the White House in Washington DC.

ai_summary: A National Guard member died after a shooting near the White House.
Another National Guard member remains in critical condition following the attack.
The suspect, an Afghan national, entered the US in 2021 via resettlement.
President Trump is considering deporting the suspect's family members.
The US will review green cards from 19 countries after the shooting.

clusters.title: Anti-corruption agents raid home of top aide to Ukraine's Zelenskyy
clusters.neutral_headline: Zelensky Aide's Home Raided in Ukraine Corruption Probe

items.title: Anti-corruption agents raid home of top aide to Ukraine's Zelenskyy
items.standfirst: Ukrainian anti-corruption officials raid the home of a top aide to President Zelenskyy in connection with a major probe into an energy sector corruption scandal.
items.content: Ukrainian anti-corruption officials raid the home of a top aide to President Zelenskyy in connection with a major probe into an energy sector corruption scandal.

items.title: Ukraine corruption scandal threatens Zelenskyy’s special relationship with top aide
items.standfirst: Police raid at the home of Kyiv’s main peace negotiator is causing shock waves across Ukraine’s political sceneThe revelations that anti-corruption police are searching the property of Volodymyr Zelenskyy’s chief of staff, Andriy Yermak, could have huge repercussions for the Ukrainian political scene and possibly for peace negotiations as well.It is hard to overstate the significance of Yermak in the Ukrainian political system. He combines multiple roles for Zelenskyy: most trusted sounding board, domestic political enforcer, controller of access to the president, main point of contact for foreign politicians and chief peace negotiator. Yermak is such a powerful chief of staff that people who know how the president’s office operates describe his relationship with Zelenskyy as symbiotic. Continue reading...
items.content: Police raid at the home of Kyiv’s main peace negotiator is causing shock waves across Ukraine’s political sceneThe revelations that anti-corruption police are searching the property of Volodymyr Zelenskyy’s chief of staff, Andriy Yermak, could have huge repercussions for the Ukrainian political scene and possibly for peace negotiations as well.It is hard to overstate the significance of Yermak in the Ukrainian political system. He combines multiple roles for Zelenskyy: most trusted sounding board, domestic political enforcer, controller of access to the president, main point of contact for foreign politicians and chief peace negotiator. Yermak is such a powerful chief of staff that people who know how the president’s office operates describe his relationship with Zelenskyy as symbiotic. Continue reading...

items.title: Anti-corruption authorities raid house of top Zelenskyy aide
items.standfirst: Search carried out at home of presidential chief of staff Andriy Yermak
items.content: Search carried out at home of presidential chief of staff Andriy Yermak

items.title: Anti-graft officers search Zelensky's chief of staff's home
items.standfirst: Ukraine’s anti-corruption agency said Friday it had launched searches targeting Andriy Yermak, the influential chief of staff to President Volodymyr Zelenskyy. The raids follow a major corruption scandal shaking Kyiv. Earlier this month, investigators said they had uncovered a $100-million kickback scheme in the strategic energy sector, sparking public outrage as Russia continues to pound the country’s power grid, causing blackouts and raising fears of winter heating shortages. France24 correspondent Gulliver Cragg reports from Ukraine.
items.content: Ukraine’s anti-corruption agency said Friday it had launched searches targeting Andriy Yermak, the influential chief of staff to President Volodymyr Zelenskyy. The raids follow a major corruption scandal shaking Kyiv. Earlier this month, investigators said they had uncovered a $100-million kickback scheme in the strategic energy sector, sparking public outrage as Russia continues to pound the country’s power grid, causing blackouts and raising fears of winter heating shortages. France24 correspondent Gulliver Cragg reports from Ukraine.

items.title: Investigators raid house of Zelensky's aide

items.content: Ukraine's National Anti-Corruption Bureau (NABU) announced on Friday that it was searching the home of Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky's Office Head, Andriy Yermak, amid a $100-million bribery ...

items.standfirst: A top Ukrainian official at the heart of peace talks was thrust Friday into the center of a massive corruption scandal, threatening to further weaken President Volodymyr Zelenskyy at a crucial moment in negotiations to end Russia's war.
items.content: A top Ukrainian official at the heart of peace talks was thrust Friday into the center of a massive corruption scandal, threatening to further weaken President Volodymyr Zelenskyy at a crucial moment in negotiations to end Russia's war.

items.title: Zelensky’s Chief of Staff Raided As Ukraine Corruption Scandal Escalates
items.standfirst: “The investigators are facing no obstacles,” Yermak wrote on Telegram, adding that he was fully cooperating with authorities.
items.content: “The investigators are facing no obstacles,” Yermak wrote on Telegram, adding that he was fully cooperating with authorities.

items.title: Ukraine’s anti-graft agency searches top Zelensky aide’s offices
items.standfirst: Ukraine's anti-corruption authorities said Friday they were searching the offices of President Volodymyr Zelensky's powerful chief of staff, Andriy Yermak.
items.content: Ukraine's anti-corruption authorities said Friday they were searching the offices of President Volodymyr Zelensky's powerful chief of staff, Andriy Yermak.

ai_summary: Ukrainian anti-corruption officials raided the home of Zelenskyy's top aide.
The raid is connected to a major corruption investigation in the energy sector.
The aide, Andriy Yermak, is a key figure in Zelenskyy's administration.
The investigation could have significant repercussions for Ukraine's politics.
The probe involves a $100 million kickback scheme in the energy sector.

items.content: The Palestinian Authority says the killings are a "war crime", while an Israeli minister backed the soldiers.

items.title: Palestinian Authority accuses Israel of 'war crime' after summary 'execution' in West Bank
items.standfirst: Israeli soldiers on Thursday appeared to kill a pair of Palestinian men in the occupied West Bank after they had surrendered to troops, drawing Palestinian accusations that the men were executed “in cold blood.” The Israeli military said it was investigating. FRANCE 24's Noga Tarnopolsky reports from Jerusalem.

clusters.title: Hong Kong tower blocks fire death toll rises to 128
clusters.neutral_headline: Hong Kong Fire Death Toll Rises to 128

items.title: Hong Kong tower blocks fire death toll rises to 128
items.standfirst: Authorities say 89 bodies are unintentified and 79 people remain injured after Wednesday's blaze.
items.content: Authorities say 89 bodies are unintentified and 79 people remain injured after Wednesday's blaze.

items.title: Rescue efforts end at Hong Kong tower block fire as death toll reaches 128
items.standfirst: Firefighters comb through high-rises with as many as 200 people still missing, according to officialsAnger swells in Hong Kong over deadliest fire in more than 70 yearsHow the Hong Kong fire unfolded – visual guideThe death toll from the Hong Kong apartment complex fire that began on Wednesday has risen to 128 with as many as 200 missing, officials have said, as rescue operations were declared over.Firefighters were combing through the high-rises on Friday morning, attempting to find anyone alive after the massive fire that spread to seven of eight towers in one of the city’s deadliest ever blazes. Continue reading...

items.title: Hong Kong fire death toll rises to 128, around 200 still missing
items.standfirst: The death toll in Hong Kong’s deadliest blaze rose to 128 people, authorities said Friday, as firefighting operations ended after a gruelling 40 hours. Around 200 people were still unaccounted for, said the city's security chief, as families desperately scoured hospital lists for information about their missing loved ones. August Hakansson and Olivier Faissolle.
items.content: The death toll in Hong Kong’s deadliest blaze rose to 128 people, authorities said Friday, as firefighting operations ended after a gruelling 40 hours. Around 200 people were still unaccounted for, said the city's security chief, as families desperately scoured hospital lists for information about their missing loved ones. August Hakansson and Olivier Faissolle.

items.title: What we know about Hong Kong’s deadliest fire in decades
items.standfirst: A fire that broke out at a Hong Kong apartment building and soon engulfed seven towers has killed at least 94 people, with hundreds still missing. Although rescue operations are still underway and total casualties are yet to be tallied, it’s already one of the city’s worst ever residential fire…
items.content: A fire that broke out at a Hong Kong apartment building and soon engulfed seven towers has killed at least 94 people, with hundreds still missing. Although rescue operations are still underway and total casualties are yet to be tallied, it’s already one of the city’s worst ever residential fire…

items.content: HONG KONG — The deadly inferno that tore through a high-rise housing estate in Hong Kong has killed at least 128 people, authorities said Friday, with some 200 people still missing.

items.content: At least 44 people have been killed in the fire, which took local authorities 18 hours to bring under control.

ai_summary: The death toll from the Hong Kong fire has reached 128.
Approximately 200 people are still unaccounted for after the blaze.
Firefighting operations have concluded after 40 hours.
The fire engulfed seven towers of a high-rise apartment complex.
The fire is one of the deadliest in Hong Kong's history.

items.title: Guinea-Bissau's ousted president leaves the country after coup
items.standfirst: In tonight's edition: Ousted Guinea-Bissau president Umaro Sissoco Embalo has arrived in Senegal after General Horta N'Tam was appointed as the country's transitional leader. Also, many women in Africa had been promised jobs in hospitality and catering, but instead found themselves building drones for the Russian war effort. And in the Congolese capital Kinshasa, entire neighbourhoods have been submerged, with streets turned into rivers. Flooding has been fuelled not just by heavy rains but by mountains of plastic waste.

items.title: Louvre hikes ticket price by 45% for most non-EU tourists in revenue push
items.standfirst: Paris’s Louvre museum said on Thursday it will raise ticket prices for most non-EU visitors, requiring tourists from the United States, Britain and China to pay $37. The 45% increase is expected to lift annual revenue by up to $23 million to fund structural upgrades after last month’s daylight theft.
items.content: Paris’s Louvre museum said on Thursday it will raise ticket prices for most non-EU visitors, requiring tourists from the United States, Britain and China to pay $37. The 45% increase is expected to lift annual revenue by up to $23 million to fund structural upgrades after last month’s daylight theft.

items.title: Most non-EU visitors will pay 45% more to visit Louvre
items.standfirst: Paris's Louvre museum said Thursday it would raise ticket prices for most non-EU visitors, meaning US, British and Chinese tourists among others will have to pay $37 to get in. The museum told AFP the 45-percent price hike aims to boost annual revenues by up to $23 million to fund structural improvements at the world's most-visited art museum, which is reeling from the daylight theft of priceless treasures last month.
items.content: Paris's Louvre museum said Thursday it would raise ticket prices for most non-EU visitors, meaning US, British and Chinese tourists among others will have to pay $37 to get in. The sentence is for 11 years, five months, and 15 days.
The sentence is related to his attempt to dissolve Congress.
Castillo tried to rule by decree in December 2022.
He was impeached and jailed on the same day.

clusters.title: Pope Leo delivers message of peace and unity in Turkey
clusters.neutral_headline: Pope Leo warns 'future of humanity is at stake' on his first foreign trip to Turkey

items.title: Pope Leo delivers message of peace and unity in Turkey
items.standfirst: “The future of humanity is at stake,” warned Pope Leo XIV during an address in Ankara, on the first leg of his trip to Turkey and Lebanon.
items.content: “The future of humanity is at stake,” warned Pope Leo XIV during an address in Ankara, on the first leg of his trip to Turkey and Lebanon.

items.title: Pope Leo on first foreign trip says future of humanity at stake from conflict
items.standfirst: The Pope makes his first foreign trip to Turkey and says a third world war is being "fought piecemeal".
items.content: The Pope makes his first foreign trip to Turkey and says a third world war is being "fought piecemeal".

items.title: Pope Leo warns 'future of humanity is at stake' on his first foreign trip to Turkey
items.standfirst: Pope Leo XIV touched down in the conflict-ridden Middle East on the first international trip of his papacy.
items.content: Pope Leo XIV touched down in the conflict-ridden Middle East on the first international trip of his papacy.

ai_summary: Pope Leo made his first foreign trip to Turkey and Lebanon.
He warned that the future of humanity is at stake.
The Pope said a third world war is being fought "piecemeal".
He delivered a message of peace and unity in Ankara.
The Pope's trip is to the conflict-ridden Middle East.
